cards.name: Adorable Kitten
cards.text: When this creature enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. You gain life equal to the result.
cards.originalText: When this creature enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. You gain life equal to the result.

cards.name: Aerial Toastmaster
cards.text:
Flying
{3}{W}, Sacrifice another artifact: Aerial Toastmaster assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
{3}{W}, Sacrifice another artifact: Aerial Toastmaster assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Amateur Auteur
cards.text: Sacrifice Amateur Auteur: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor:
And thus at Maze's End
the runners end their strife.
Our saving grace, that hooded kid,
is now Guildpact for life.
—RAVNICA! The Musical
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Amateur Auteur: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: By Gnome Means
cards.text:
{1}{W}, Remove a counter from a permanent you control: Create a 1/1 colorless Gnome artifact creature token.
{1}{W}, Sacrifice an artifact: Choose any kind of counter a printed card refers to, then put one of that counter on target permanent.
cards.flavor: There's no race like gnome.
cards.originalText:
{1}{W}, Remove a counter from a permanent you control: Create a 1/1 colorless Gnome artifact creature token.
{1}{W}, Sacrifice an artifact: Choose any kind of counter a printed card refers to, then put one of that counter on target permanent.

cards.name: Chivalrous Chevalier
cards.text:
Flying
When Chivalrous Chevalier enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand unless you compliment an opponent.
cards.flavor: "I treat every foe according to the highest codes of conduct. Then I kill them."
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Chivalrous Chevalier enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand unless you compliment an opponent.

cards.name: Do-It-Yourself Seraph
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Do-It-Yourself Seraph attacks, you may search your library for an artifact card, exile it, then shuffle your library.
Do-It-Yourself Seraph has the text box of each card exiled with Do-It-Yourself Seraph in addition to its own.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Do-It-Yourself Seraph attacks, you may search your library for an artifact card, exile it, then shuffle your library.
Do-It-Yourself Seraph has the text box of each card exiled with Do-It-Yourself Seraph in addition to its own.

cards.name: Gimme Five
cards.text: You gain 1 life for each person who high-fives you in the next thirty seconds. Each player in a silver-bordered game who high-fives you gains 1 life. (Offer high fives. Don't hit people.)
cards.flavor: "Up high! To the side! Down low! To the left! Other left! Over here—"
cards.originalText: You gain 1 life for each person who high-fives you in the next thirty seconds. Each player in a silver-bordered game who high-fives you gains 1 life. (Offer high fives. Don't hit people.)

cards.name: GO TO JAIL
cards.text:
When GO TO JAIL enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until GO TO JAIL leaves the battlefield.
At the beginning of the upkeep of the exiled card's owner, that player rolls two six-sided dice. If he or she rolls doubles, sacrifice GO TO JAIL.
cards.originalText:
When GO TO JAIL enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until GO TO JAIL leaves the battlefield.
At the beginning of the upkeep of the exiled card's owner, that player rolls two six-sided dice. If he or she rolls doubles, sacrifice GO TO JAIL.

cards.name: Half-Kitten, Half-
cards.text:
Whenever you're dealt damage,
Augment {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Whenever you're dealt damage,
Augment {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Humming-
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you attack with two or more creatures,
Augment {3}{W} ({3}{W}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you attack with two or more creatures,
Augment {3}{W} ({3}{W}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Jackknight
cards.text: Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Jackknight. If that artifact is a Contraption, Jackknight gains lifelink until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "My sword is at your service, as are my scissors, corkscrew, and bottle opener."
cards.originalText: Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Jackknight. If that artifact is a Contraption, Jackknight gains lifelink until end of turn.

cards.name: Knight of the Kitchen Sink
cards.text: First strike, protection from black borders (Nothing with a black border can block, target, deal damage to, or attach to this creature.)
cards.flavor: "Whew. For a minute, I thought I'd forgotten the garlic press."
cards.originalText: First strike, protection from black borders (Nothing with a black border can block, target, deal damage to, or attach to this creature.)

cards.name: Knight of the Widget
cards.text:
Vigilance
Knight of the Widget's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Order of the Widget watermarks among permanents you control.
cards.flavor: His armor is lightweight titanium alloy, but his will is iron.
cards.originalText:
Vigilance
Knight of the Widget's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Order of the Widget watermarks among permanents you control.

cards.name: Midlife Upgrade
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Midlife Upgrade, sacrifice X Contraptions.
Assemble X plus one Contraptions. (To assemble a Contraption, put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Midlife Upgrade, sacrifice X Contraptions.
Assemble X plus one Contraptions. (To assemble a Contraption, put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Oddly Uneven
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy each creature with an odd number of words in its name. (Hyphenated words are one word.)
• Destroy each creature with an even number of words in its name.
cards.flavor: The odds are good, but the goods are odd.
cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• Destroy each creature with an odd number of words in its name. (Hyphenated words are one word.)
• Destroy each creature with an even number of words in its name.

cards.name: Old Guard
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature without reminder text. (Reminder text is still any italicized text in parentheses that explains rules you already know.)
cards.flavor: "You say you're capable of flying. You got any proof of that?"
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature without reminder text. (Reminder text is still any italicized text in parentheses that explains rules you already know.)

cards.name: Ordinary Pony
cards.text: When this creature enters the battlefield, you may exile target non-Horse creature you control that wasn't put onto the battlefield with this ability this turn, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.originalText: When this creature enters the battlefield, you may exile target non-Horse creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.name: Rhino-
cards.text:
Whenever this creature blocks,
Augment {3}{W} ({3}{W}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Whenever this creature blocks,
Augment {3}{W} ({3}{W}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Riveting Rigger
cards.text: When Riveting Rigger enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice another artifact. If you do, put two +1/+1 counters on Riveting Rigger and it assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.flavor: "Turn a blender into an arc welder with a portable fusion reactor and a frozen yogurt dispenser? We can do it!"
cards.originalText: When Riveting Rigger enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice another artifact. If you do, put two +1/+1 counters on Riveting Rigger and it assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Rules Lawyer
cards.text: State-based actions don't apply to you or other permanents you control. (You don't lose the game due to having 0 or less life or drawing from an empty library. Your creatures aren't destroyed due to damage or deathtouch and aren't put into a graveyard due to having 0 or less toughness. Your planeswalkers aren't put into a graveyard if they have 0 loyalty. You don't put a legendary permanent into a graveyard if you control two with the same name. Counters aren't removed from your permanents due to game rules. Permanents you control attached or combined illegally remain on the battlefield. For complete rules and regulations, see rule 704.)
cards.originalText: State-based actions don't apply to you or other permanents you control. (You don't lose the game due to having 0 or less life or drawing from an empty library. Your creatures aren't destroyed due to damage or deathtouch and aren't put into a graveyard due to having 0 or less toughness. Your planeswalkers aren't put into a graveyard if they have 0 loyalty. You don't put a legendary permanent into a graveyard if you control two with the same name. Counters aren't removed from your permanents due to game rules. Permanents you control attached or combined illegally remain on the battlefield. For complete rules and regulations, see rule 704.)

cards.name: Sacrifice Play
cards.text: A person outside the game chooses an attacking or blocking creature target opponent controls. That player sacrifices that creature.
cards.flavor: In recursive chess, one piece can capture another only after beating it in a game of recursive chess.
cards.originalText: A person outside the game chooses an attacking or blocking creature target opponent controls. That player sacrifices that creature.

cards.name: Shaggy Camel
cards.text: When this creature enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: When this creature enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Side Quest
cards.text: Target player in a silver-bordered game you can see from your seat gains control of target creature you control until your next turn. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put two +1/+1 counters on that creature. (A creature is on the battlefield of only the game its controller is playing.)
cards.originalText: Target player in a silver-bordered game you can see from your seat gains control of target creature you control until your next turn. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put two +1/+1 counters on that creature. (A creature is on the battlefield of only the game its controller is playing.)

cards.name: Success!
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it's a host or has augment, it gains lifelink until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Those who witness my work often question its necessity. I've never understood that."
—Dr. Julius Jumblemorph
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it's a host or has augment, it gains lifelink until end of turn.

cards.name: Teacher's Pet
cards.text: {2}{W}, Sacrifice Teacher's Pet: Search your library for a card with augment, combine it with target host you control, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "First attempt: unsuccessful. Instead of an amphibious chicken, hybridization produced an aquaphobic fish."
cards.originalText: {2}{W}, Sacrifice Teacher's Pet: Search your library for a card with augment, combine it with target host you control, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Animate Library
cards.text:
Enchant your library
Enchanted library is an artifact creature on the battlefield with power and toughness each equal to the number of cards in it. It's still a library.
If enchanted library would leave the battlefield, exile Animate Library instead.
cards.flavor: Sometimes the books hit back.
cards.originalText:
Enchant your library
Enchanted library is an artifact creature on the battlefield with power and toughness each equal to the number of cards in it. It's still a library.
If enchanted library would leave the battlefield, exile Animate Library instead.

cards.name: Blurry Beeble
cards.text:
Blurry (This creature can be blocked only if defending player was wearing glasses as it was cast.)
Whenever Blurry Beeble deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
cards.originalText:
Blurry (This creature can be blocked only if defending player was wearing glasses as it was cast.)
Whenever Blurry Beeble deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.

cards.name: Chipper Chopper
cards.text:
Flying
When Chipper Chopper enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice another artifact. If you do, put two +1/+1 counters on Chipper Chopper and it assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Chipper Chopper enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice another artifact. If you do, put two +1/+1 counters on Chipper Chopper and it assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Clocknapper
cards.text: When Clocknapper enters the battlefield, choose beginning phase, precombat main phase, combat phase, postcombat main phase, or ending phase. Steal that phase from target player during his or her next turn. (That phase occurs as though it's your turn instead.)
cards.originalText: When Clocknapper enters the battlefield, choose beginning phase, precombat main phase, combat phase, postcombat main phase, or ending phase. Steal that phase from target player during his or her next turn. (That phase occurs as though it's your turn instead.)

cards.name: Crafty Octopus
cards.text: When this creature enters the battlefield, this creature assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.originalText: When this creature enters the battlefield, this creature assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Crow Storm
cards.text:
Create a 1/2 blue Bird creature token with flying named Storm Crow.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)
cards.flavor:
Storm crow lonely, boon for a birder.
Storm crows together, likely a murder.
cards.originalText:
Create a 1/2 blue Bird creature token with flying named Storm Crow.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

cards.name: Defective Detective
cards.text:
Defective Detective can't be blocked.
When Defective Detective enters the battlefield, a person outside the game looks at target opponent's hand and chooses a card from it. That player reveals that card.
cards.flavor: Nothing gets by her . . . except the evidence, the motive, and the culprit.
cards.originalText:
Defective Detective can't be blocked.
When Defective Detective enters the battlefield, a person outside the game looks at target opponent's hand and chooses a card from it. That player reveals that card.

cards.name: Five-Finger Discount
cards.text: Put target nonland permanent into your hand. You may spend mana as though it were mana of any color the next time you cast that card.
cards.flavor: "Dognapping is such an ugly word. I would characterize this as a unilateral redistribution of pets."
cards.originalText: Put target nonland permanent into your hand. You may spend mana as though it were mana of any color the next time you cast that card.

cards.name: Graveyard Busybody
cards.text:
All graveyards are also your graveyards.
Graveyard Busybody's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards with flavor text in your graveyards.
cards.flavor: You have to hang around the graveyard if you want to catch the talking dead.
cards.originalText:
All graveyards are also your graveyards.
Graveyard Busybody's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards with flavor text in your graveyards.

cards.name: Half-Shark, Half-
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep,
Augment {5}{U} ({5}{U}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep,
Augment {5}{U} ({5}{U}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Incite Insight
cards.text: Assemble X Contraptions. (To assemble a Contraption, put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.flavor: After a hundred failed patent applications, Cornelian was stunned to find that no one had ever created a steam-powered autonomous ice cream delivery system. He immediately designed a gnome with scoops for hands.
cards.originalText: Assemble X Contraptions. (To assemble a Contraption, put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Kindly Cognician
cards.text: Spells you cast that refer to artifacts or Contraptions in their rules text cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: "What's wrong, dear? Nothing a 44-to-22 bronze spur gear and reducer pairing couldn't fix, I bet."
cards.originalText: Spells you cast that refer to artifacts or Contraptions in their rules text cost {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Magic Word
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As Magic Word enters the battlefield, choose a word.
Whisper the chosen word: Tap enchanted creature.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
As Magic Word enters the battlefield, choose a word.
Whisper the chosen word: Tap enchanted creature.

cards.name: Mer Man
cards.text: When this creature enters the battlefield, you may draw a card.
cards.originalText: When this creature enters the battlefield, you may draw a card.

cards.name: More or Less
cards.text: Add or subtract 1 or one from a number or number word on target spell or permanent until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Why was 5 afraid of 6? Because 678.
cards.originalText: Add or subtract 1 or one from a number or number word on target spell or permanent until end of turn.

cards.name: Novellamental
cards.text:
Flying
Novellamental can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: "My grandmother had sold the rest of her jewelry long ago, but she left a particular necklace in my care: a golden chain, bearing a raven-shaped charm."
cards.originalText:
Flying
Novellamental can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Numbing Jellyfish
cards.text: When this creature enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the result.
cards.originalText: When this creature enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the result.

cards.name: S.N.E.A.K. Dispatcher
cards.text: {2}{U}, {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. If it has an Agents of S.N.E.A.K. watermark, you may reveal it and put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it on the top or bottom of its owner's library.
cards.originalText: {2}{U}, {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. If it has an Agents of S.N.E.A.K. watermark, you may reveal it and put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it on the top or bottom of its owner's library.

cards.name: Socketed Sprocketer
cards.text:
{T}: Uninstall all results from Socketed Sprocketer, then roll a six-sided die. Install the result on Socketed Sprocketer. (Put the die on this card.)
You may uninstall a result from Socketed Sprocketer to use it for a die you rolled.
Uninstall a 6 from Socketed Sprocketer: Draw a card.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Uninstall all results from Socketed Sprocketer, then roll a six-sided die. Install the result on Socketed Sprocketer. (Put the die on this card.)
You may uninstall a result from Socketed Sprocketer to use it for a die you rolled.
Uninstall a 6 from Socketed Sprocketer: Draw a card.

cards.name: Spell Suck
cards.text: Counter target spell, then assemble a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.flavor: S-U-C-K
cards.originalText: Counter target spell, then assemble a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Spy Eye
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Spy Eye deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card from that player's library.
cards.flavor:
"That pigeon knows something, and we will find out what."
—X
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Spy Eye deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card from that player's library.

cards.name: Suspicious Nanny
cards.text: Whenever Suspicious Nanny deals combat damage to a player, it reassembles target Contraption that player controls. (Gain control of it and move it onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.flavor: "Afternoon, folks. Lovely day for a stroll with my authentic human baby."
cards.originalText: Whenever Suspicious Nanny deals combat damage to a player, it reassembles target Contraption that player controls. (Gain control of it and move it onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Time Out
cards.text: Roll a six-sided die. Put target nonland permanent into its owner's library just beneath the top X cards of that library, where X is the result.
cards.flavor: Anyone other than a goblin would've gotten only a hand caught in the cookie jar.
cards.originalText: Roll a six-sided die. Put target nonland permanent into its owner's library just beneath the top X cards of that library, where X is the result.

cards.name: Very Cryptic Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Untap two target permanents.
• Tap each permanent target player controls with exactly one word in its name.
• Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
• Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText:
Choose two —
• Untap two target permanents.
• Tap each permanent target player controls with exactly one word in its name.
• Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
• Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Wall of Fortune
cards.text:
Defender
You may tap an untapped Wall you control to have any player reroll a die that player rolled.
cards.flavor: "You need a six? All right everyone, she needs a six!"
cards.originalText:
Defender
You may tap an untapped Wall you control to have any player reroll a die that player rolled.

cards.name: Big Boa Constrictor
cards.text: When this creature enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. Target opponent loses life equal to the result.
cards.originalText: When this creature enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. Target opponent loses life equal to the result.

cards.name: capital offense
cards.text: target creature gets -x/-x until end of turn, where x is the number of times a capital letter appears in its rules text. (ignore reminder text and flavor text.)
cards.flavor: part basket case, all lowercase.
cards.originalText: target creature gets -x/-x until end of turn, where x is the number of times a capital letter appears in its rules text. (ignore reminder text and flavor text.)

cards.name: Dirty Rat
cards.text: When this creature enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.originalText: When this creature enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Extremely Slow Zombie
cards.text: Last strike (This creature deals combat damage after creatures without last strike.)
cards.flavor: Brrrrrrrrrrrr . . .
cards.originalText: Last strike (This creature deals combat damage after creatures without last strike.)

cards.name: Finders, Keepers
cards.text: Destroy target creature, then assemble a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.flavor: The S.N.E.A.K. Code clearly permits looting corpses for parts. That just meant Agent 47.3 had to make sure her target was dead first.
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature, then assemble a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Hangman
cards.text:
As Hangman enters the battlefield, secretly note a word with six to eight letters.
{1}: Target player who doesn't control Hangman guesses the noted word or an unguessed letter in that word. If he or she guesses wrong, put a +1/+1 counter on Hangman. Any player may activate this ability.
When a player guesses the noted word or all of its letters, sacrifice Hangman.
cards.originalText:
As Hangman enters the battlefield, secretly note a word with six to eight letters.
{1}: Target player who doesn't control Hangman guesses the noted word or an unguessed letter in that word. If he or she guesses wrong, put a +1/+1 counter on Hangman. Any player may activate this ability.
When a player guesses the noted word or all of its letters, sacrifice Hangman.

cards.name: Hazmat Suit (Used)
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has menace.
Whenever a player's skin or fingernail touches enchanted creature, that player loses 2 life.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has menace.
Whenever a player's skin or fingernail touches enchanted creature, that player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Hoisted Hireling
cards.text: Hoisted Hireling has flying as long as it's being held above the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Zarv no longer trusted the kitten posters telling him to "hang in there."
cards.originalText: Hoisted Hireling has flying as long as it's being held above the battlefield.

cards.name: Inhumaniac
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, roll a six-sided die. On a 3 or 4, put a +1/+1 counter on Inhumaniac. On a 5 or higher, put two +1/+1 counters on it. On a 1, remove all +1/+1 counters from Inhumaniac.
cards.flavor: For the mind-minded mastermind.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, roll a six-sided die. On a 3 or 4, put a +1/+1 counter on Inhumaniac. On a 5 or higher, put two +1/+1 counters on it. On a 1, remove all +1/+1 counters from Inhumaniac.

cards.name: Masterful Ninja
cards.text:
Haste
Reveal Masterful Ninja from your hand: Masterful Ninja is on the battlefield and in your hand until end of turn.
{1}{B}: Masterful Ninja gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Haste
Reveal Masterful Ninja from your hand: Masterful Ninja is on the battlefield and in your hand until end of turn.

cards.text:
You may activate Ninja's augment ability any time you could cast an instant.
Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player,
Augment {2}{B} ({2}{B}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as—oh, nevermind.)

cards.name: Old-Fashioned Vampire
cards.text:
Flying
Old-Fashioned Vampire gets +2/+2 and has deathtouch as long as it's dark outdoors.
cards.flavor: "Stalking hard or hardly stalking, am I right?"
cards.originalText:
Flying
Old-Fashioned Vampire gets +2/+2 and has deathtouch as long as it's dark outdoors.

cards.name: Over My Dead Bodies
cards.text:
Creature cards in graveyards can attack and block as though they were on the battlefield, can block or be blocked only by creature cards in graveyards, are Zombies in addition to their other types, and have undeathtouch. (If they would deal damage to a creature card, exile that creature card instead.)
Creature cards in your graveyard have haste.

Creature cards in graveyards can attack and block as though they were on the battlefield, can block or be blocked only by creature cards in graveyards, are Zombies in addition to their other types, and have undeathtouch. (If they would deal damage to a creature card, exile that creature card instead.)
Creature cards in your graveyard have haste.

cards.name: Overt Operative
cards.text:
Menace
Whenever Overt Operative deals combat damage to a player, it assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.flavor: Saw her coming. Didn't matter.
cards.originalText:
Menace
Whenever Overt Operative deals combat damage to a player, it assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: "Rumors of My Death . . ."
cards.text: {3}{B}, Exile a permanent you control with a League of Dastardly Doom watermark: Return a permanent card with a League of Dastardly Doom watermark from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: By the fourth funeral, the mooks had gotten pretty good at them.
cards.originalText: {3}{B}, Exile a permanent you control with a League of Dastardly Doom watermark: Return a permanent card with a League of Dastardly Doom watermark from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Skull Saucer
cards.text:
Flying
When Skull Saucer enters the battlefield, destroy target creature and put your head on the table. Sacrifice Skull Saucer when your head stops touching the table.
cards.flavor: No body is ready for this kind of power.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Skull Saucer enters the battlefield, destroy target creature and put your head on the table. Sacrifice Skull Saucer when your head stops touching the table.

cards.name: Sly Spy
cards.text: Whenever Sly Spy deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it with the longest name. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: The Agents of S.N.E.A.K.—Serious, Nonstop Espionage and Kidnapping.
cards.originalText: Whenever Sly Spy deals combat damage to a player, that player reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it with the longest name. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Snickering Squirrel
cards.text: You may tap Snickering Squirrel to increase the result of a die any player rolled by 1.
cards.flavor: "In this line of work, you've got to know how to squirrel things away. Quite literally, in my case."
cards.originalText: You may tap Snickering Squirrel to increase the result of a die any player rolled by 1.

cards.name: Spike, Tournament Grinder
cards.text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
{B/P}{B/P}{B/P}{B/P}: Choose a card you own from outside the game that has been banned or restricted in a Constructed format, reveal that card, and put it into your hand.
cards.flavor: "Just wait—I have a response."
cards.originalText:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
{B/P}{B/P}{B/P}{B/P}: Choose a card you own from outside the game that has been banned or restricted in a Constructed format, reveal that card, and put it into your hand.

cards.name: Squirrel-Powered Scheme
cards.text: Increase the result of each die you roll by 2.
cards.flavor: Lucinda didn't know which she enjoyed most: the science, the squirrels, or the maniacal laughter.
cards.originalText: Increase the result of each die you roll by 2.

cards.name: Steady-Handed Mook
cards.text:
Deathtouch
When Steady-Handed Mook enters the battlefield, it assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.flavor: A mook's life span is just long enough to get just good enough to get careless.
cards.originalText:
Deathtouch
When Steady-Handed Mook enters the battlefield, it assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Stinging Scorpion
cards.text: When this creature enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: When this creature enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Subcontract
cards.text: A person outside the game looks at target opponent's hand and chooses a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: Martha was in and out in exactly two minutes—thirty seconds to administer the poison plus a minute and a half to properly refold the napkins.
cards.originalText: A person outside the game looks at target opponent's hand and chooses a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Summon the Pack
cards.text: Open a sealed Magic booster pack, reveal the cards, and put all creature cards revealed this way onto the battlefield under your control. They're Zombies in addition to their other types. (Remove those cards from your deck before beginning a new game.)
cards.originalText: Open a sealed Magic booster pack, reveal the cards, and put all creature cards revealed this way onto the battlefield under your control. They're Zombies in addition to their other types. (Remove those cards from your deck before beginning a new game.)

cards.name: Zombified
cards.text:
{4}{B}: Combine Zombified from your graveyard with target host.
{2}{B}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard:
Augment {4}{B} ({4}{B}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
{4}{B}: Combine Zombified from your graveyard with target host.
{2}{B}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard:
Augment {4}{B} ({4}{B}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: The Big Idea
cards.text:
{2}{B/R}{B/R}, {T}: Roll a six-sided die. Create a number of 1/1 red Brainiac creature tokens equal to the result.
Tap three untapped Brainiacs you control: The next time you would roll a six-sided die, instead roll two six-sided dice and use the total of those results.
cards.originalText:
{2}{B/R}{B/R}, {T}: Roll a six-sided die. Create a number of 1/1 red Brainiac creature tokens equal to the result.
Tap three untapped Brainiacs you control: The next time you would roll a six-sided die, instead roll two six-sided dice and use the total of those results.

cards.name: Box of Free-Range Goblins
cards.text: Roll a six-sided die. Create a number of 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens equal to the result.
cards.flavor: Skrab tried to warn his fellow goblins that the hammer was bait for a trap, but they stopped listening at "hammer."
cards.originalText: Roll a six-sided die. Create a number of 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens equal to the result.

cards.name: Bumbling Pangolin
cards.text: When this creature enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact.
cards.originalText: When this creature enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Common Iguana
cards.text: When this creature enters the battlefield, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
cards.originalText: When this creature enters the battlefield, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: The Countdown Is at One
cards.text: Players play a Magic subgame, starting at 1 life and using their libraries as their decks. For the rest of the main game, if a source would deal damage to a player who didn't win the subgame, it deals double that damage to that player instead.
cards.originalText: Players play a Magic subgame, starting at 1 life and using their libraries as their decks. For the rest of the main game, if a source would deal damage to a player who didn't win the subgame, it deals double that damage to that player instead.

cards.name: Feisty Stegosaurus
cards.text: When this creature enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. This creature deals damage equal to the result to target creature an opponent controls.
cards.originalText: When this creature enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. This creature deals damage equal to the result to target creature an opponent controls.

cards.name: Garbage Elemental
cards.text:
Frenzy 2 (Whenever this creature attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.)
Garbage Elemental can't be blocked by wordy creatures. (A creature is wordy if it has four or more lines of rules text.)
cards.originalText:
Frenzy 2 (Whenever this creature attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.)
Garbage Elemental can't be blocked by wordy creatures. (A creature is wordy if it has four or more lines of rules text.)

cards.name: Goblin Haberdasher
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Other creatures you control wearing hats in their art have menace.
cards.flavor: An accessory in every sense of the word.
cards.originalText:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Other creatures you control wearing hats in their art have menace.

cards.name: Half-Orc, Half-
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of each end step, if an opponent was dealt damage this turn,
Augment {1}{R}{R} ({1}{R}{R}, Reveal this card from your hand: Combine it with target host. Augment only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Trample
At the beginning of each end step, if an opponent was dealt damage this turn,

cards.name: Hammer Helper
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature and roll a six-sided die. Until end of turn, it gains haste and gets +X/+0, where X is the result.
cards.flavor: "Need a hammer? Gotta get your fix? I know a guy."
cards.originalText: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature and roll a six-sided die. Until end of turn, it gains haste and gets +X/+0, where X is the result.

cards.name: Hammer Jammer
cards.text:
As Hammer Jammer enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. Hammer Jammer enters the battlefield with a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the result.
Whenever you roll a die, remove all +1/+1 counters from Hammer Jammer, then put a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the result.
cards.originalText:
As Hammer Jammer enters the battlefield, roll a six-sided die. Hammer Jammer enters the battlefield with a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the result.
Whenever you roll a die, remove all +1/+1 counters from Hammer Jammer, then put a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the result.

cards.name: Hammerfest Boomtacular
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell with a Goblin Explosioneers watermark, Hammerfest Boomtacular deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: It's less "music" and more "straightforward hearing damage."
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a spell with a Goblin Explosioneers watermark, Hammerfest Boomtacular deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: It That Gets Left Hanging
cards.text: When It That Gets Left Hanging enters the battlefield, ask a person outside the game to high-five you. If he or she won't, It That Gets Left Hanging gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Give me . . . some skin."
cards.originalText: When It That Gets Left Hanging enters the battlefield, ask a person outside the game to high-five you. If he or she won't, It That Gets Left Hanging gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Just Desserts
cards.text: Just Desserts deals π damage to target creature. (π is the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter. (It's a smidgen more than 3.))
cards.flavor:
"It's time to put the 'die' in 'diameter!'"
—Flaky the Irrational
cards.originalText: Just Desserts deals π damage to target creature. (π is the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter. (It's a smidgen more than 3.))

cards.name: Painiac
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, roll a six-sided die. Painiac gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the result.
cards.flavor: "You're about to be struck by a brilliant idea!"
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, roll a six-sided die. Painiac gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the result.

cards.name: Party Crasher
cards.text:
Haste
You can attack with Party Crasher once each combat during each opponent's turn.
cards.flavor: No rest. No mercy. No reservations.
cards.originalText:
Haste
You can attack with Party Crasher once each combat during each opponent's turn.

cards.name: Steamflogger Boss
cards.text:
Other Riggers you control get +1/+0 and have haste.
If a Rigger you control would assemble a Contraption, it assembles two Contraptions instead.
cards.flavor:
"Don't quit now, we're almost done.
Then we'll build another one!"
cards.originalText:
Other Riggers you control get +1/+0 and have haste.
If a Rigger you control would assemble a Contraption, it assembles two Contraptions instead.

cards.name: Steamflogger of the Month
cards.text: When Steamflogger of the Month enters the battlefield, it assembles a Contraption for each Contraption you control. (To assemble a Contraption, put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.flavor: The perks aren't great.
cards.originalText: When Steamflogger of the Month enters the battlefield, it assembles a Contraption for each Contraption you control. (To assemble a Contraption, put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Steamflogger Temp
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Steamflogger Temp assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.flavor: When you're dumber than a hammer, every problem looks like one of those things you hit with a hammer.
cards.originalText: {6}, {T}: Steamflogger Temp assembles a Contraption. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Steamfloggery
cards.text: Roll a six-sided die. Assemble a number of Contraptions equal to the result. (To assemble a Contraption, put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)
cards.flavor: Goblins only have two speeds: hard loaf and full-on hammer freak-out.
cards.originalText: Roll a six-sided die. Assemble a number of Contraptions equal to the result. (To assemble a Contraption, put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets.)

cards.name: Super-Duper Death Ray
cards.text:
Trample (This spell can deal excess damage to its target's controller.)
Super-Duper Death Ray deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: "Comin' through!"
cards.originalText:
Trample (This spell can deal excess damage to its target's controller.)
Super-Duper Death Ray deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Target Minotaur
cards.text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: "Not again!"
cards.originalText: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Three-Headed Goblin
cards.text: Triple strike (This creature deals first-strike, regular, and last-strike combat damage.)
cards.flavor: It's true that two heads are better than one, but after that you run into diminishing returns.
cards.originalText: Triple strike (This creature deals first-strike, regular, and last-strike combat damage.)

cards.name: Work a Double
cards.text: Assemble two Contraptions. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets. Then repeat this process.)
cards.flavor: Ig and Burf discovered the technique by accident when Burf reached for his hammer and missed.
cards.originalText: Assemble two Contraptions. (Put the top card of your Contraption deck face up onto one of your sprockets. Then repeat this process.)
